trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides a description of the results of the query and its effect on the database.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx x xxxxxxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxx xxxxx xxx xxx xxxxxx xx xxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

When the command is executed, the associated Connection object is closed when the associated DataReader object is closed.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxx xxx xxxxxxx xx xxxxxxxx$ xxx xxxxxxxxxx $xxxxxx$Xxxxxxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxx xx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxx $xxxxxx$XxxxXxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxx xx xxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The query returns column and primary key information.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxxxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
\n

Provides a way for the DataReader to handle rows that contain columns with large binary values.
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxxxxxxx x xxx xxx xxx $xxxxxx$XxxxXxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxxxx xxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxxxxxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxx xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source: Rather than loading the entire row, SequentialAccess enables the DataReader to load data as a stream.
trans-unit.target: Xxxxxx xxxx xxxxxxx xxx xxxxxx xxx$ $xxxxxx$XxxxxxxxxxXxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxxx xxx $xxxxxx$XxxxXxxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx xxxx xxxx xx x xxxxxx.

trans-unit.source:
You can then use the GetBytes or GetChars method to specify a byte location to start the read operation, and a limited buffer size for the data being returned.

\n
trans-unit.target: Xxx xxx xxxx xxx xxx $xxxxxx$XxxXxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xx $xxxxxx$XxxXxxxx$$xxxxxx$ xxxxxx xx xxxxxxx x xxxx xxxxxxxx xx xxxxx xxx xxxx xxxxxxxxx$ xxx x xxxxxxx xxxxxx xxxx xxx xxx xxxx xxxxx xxxxxxxx.$$x$$x

trans-unit.source:
\n

The query returns a single result set.

\n
trans-unit.target: $x$x$Xxx xxxxx xxxxxxx x xxxxxx xxxxxx xxx.$$x$$x
